ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 88
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Even if there was any anticamping areas areas which I doubt very much I don t think the solution is to make a monster spawn once every 12 hours and only
ygData.messageBody:
>
>
> Message: 1
> Date: Fri, 06 Aug 1999 04:09:23 PDT
> From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>
> Subject: Re: ___JBoots___ and Anticamping coding
>
> >From: "IDS" <ids@...>
> >There is no anti-camp vode in this game. You should sit in the room >not
> >the little corridor because sitting in the corridor pulls moosh >from the
> >basement cells.
> >
> >I got my boots on my second visit, luckyly in about 4 hours, 2 boots
> > >spawned back to back so the magician that was with me got a pair too.
> >
>
> Was wondering where you get your info from? I have spoken with GM's and
> guides alike - there IS anti-camping coding in the game. They're just not
> implemented everywhere! You need to figure out where they are. I personally
> have tested areas in Befallen, and have found it to be true, because certain
> creatures spawn quicker with no campers in the area. In other areas,
> creatures spawn just as quickly with or without campers.
>
> And even if you don't believe me, what do you think having a 4+ hour respawn
> rate is? Chopped liver? In my book, that's just another form of anti-camping
> code meant to discourage camping to me!
>
>

Even if there was any anticamping areas areas which I doubt very much I don't think the solution is
to make a monster spawn once every 12 hours and only have the item every tenth time it spawns. Some
people that pay to play this game and want a certain object have to work, sleep and other stuff in
real life and can't camp for 18 hours straight like the students. And when I've killed bonecracker
11 times in a row and still don't get a whip its just plain boring. I already shown that I can kill
him. Let me have my whip so I can leave and let some other person try...
